item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; 600 Broke, Profit Taken! - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; 600 Broke, Profit Taken! - NEWSBTC

Here's a look at what we are focusing on in the bitcoin price this morning. So this morning we are going to go for something a little different. Over the last couple of weeks we have primarily been focusing on horizontal range bound trading, with a few breakout entries whenever we saw some volatility.

item.description:

item.title: UNICEF Seeks Developer for Innovation Projects including Blockchain's Humanitarian Uses
item.description:
UNICEF Seeks Developer for Innovation Projects including Blockchain's Humanitarian Uses

UNICEF is looking for a software developer/consultant in New York City for an 11.5-month assignment in its Office of Innovation. The developer will assist in the development of blockchain's humanitarian uses, according to a posted notice. The developer will help create products to solve problems in developing nations.

item.title: Bitfinex executive says 119,756 bitcoin stolen from Hong Kong exchange
item.description:
Bitfinex executive says 119,756 bitcoin stolen from Hong Kong exchange

Technology | Wed Aug 3, 2016 2:29am EDT HONG KONG Nearly 120,000 bitcoin has been stolen from the exchange platform Bitfinex in Hong Kong, an executive from the bourse said on Wednesday. Zane Tackett, Director of Community & Product Development, was speaking to Reuters after the digital currency exchange suspended trading after it discovered a security breach.

item.title: The Arduous Task of Regulating Bitcoin
item.description:
The Arduous Task of Regulating Bitcoin

Regulatory uncertainty will continue to inhibit the widespread adoption of cryptocurrencies. Though the U.S. federal government has made progress in regulating cryptocurrencies, uncertainty and ambiguity at the state level will be more difficult to overcome. Blockchain, the technology underpinning cryptocurrencies, will have a greater impact than the cryptocurrencies derived from it.

item.title: How Far Away is The Next Global Financial Collapse?
item.description:
How Far Away is The Next Global Financial Collapse?

At the same time, people may look back on the impending financial collapse in a few years from now, and say "We should have seen it coming". Over the past few months, there has been a lot of speculation regarding a new financial crisis.

item.title: Elliptic and LexisNexis bring bank-grade AML to Bitcoin
item.description:
Elliptic and LexisNexis bring bank-grade AML to Bitcoin

Blockchain intelligence outfit Elliptic is teaming up with LexisNexis Risk Solutions to bring what they claim is bank-grade risk management to Bitcoin. Elliptic will integrate LexisNexis's anti-money laundering risk management data into its Bitcoin transaction monitoring and compliance products.

item.title: Is BitGo To Blame For The Bitfinex Bitcoin Theft?
item.description:
Is BitGo To Blame For The Bitfinex Bitcoin Theft?

In light of the recent Bitfinex attack, BitGo revealed a rather interesting statement. The company claimed their own investigation has yielded no evidence of a breach of any of their servers during the Bitfinex attack. This is rather strange, as all of the missing funds was drained from multisignature wallets, which should be secured by BitGo's technology.

item.title: Why is it not possible to replay transactions?
item.description:
Why is it not possible to replay transactions?

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. Join them; it only takes a minute: Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top Transaction inputs use Unspent Transaction Outputs (UTXO).
